====Ctrl-Win-Alt-Space====
Ctrl-Win-Alt-Space shows [ConEmuTerms#RealConsole real console window].

On some systems (Vista, i.e.) You must press Space twice.

====Buffer scrolling====
Ctrl-Up, Ctrl-Down, Ctrl-!PgUp, Ctrl-!PgDn

====System menu====
Win-Alt-Space pops up !ConEmu [SystemMenu system menu].

====Settings dialog====
Win-Alt-P opens [Settings Settings dialog].

====!FullScreen mode====
Ctrl-Win-Enter maximize !ConEmu window and hide window caption.

====Tabs switching====
Ctrl-Tab and Ctrl-Shift-Tab

In lazy switching mode (tab bar must be visible) window will not be really switched, until Ctrl is released.

When lazy tab switching was started in recent mode, You may use Left and Right keys to select tabs directly.

====Configurable hotkeys====
|| *Multiconsole* || ||
|| [KeyboardShortcuts#Confirmation_of_new_console_creation_(Win-W) Win-W] || Create new console tab. *W* is default. ||
|| [KeyboardShortcuts#Confirmation_of_restarting_console_(Win-%7E) Win-~] || Restart current console, all applications running in the current console will be terminated, *configurable* ||
|| Win-Q, Win-Shift-Q || Activate next/previous console tab, *configurable* ||
|| Win-Del || Terminate current console. This hotkey is *disabled* by default! You may enable it in the [Settings Settings] ||
|| Win-A || *Ignored in Windows 7*. Turns [ConEmuTerms#BufferHeight BufferHeight] mode on/off. *A* is default. ||
|| Win-1, ..., Win-9, Win-0, Win-F11, Win-F12 || Select console by number (1 throw 12) ||
|| *Minimize/Restore* || ||
|| Win-C || Minimize or Restore !ConEmu window. *W* is default, you may choose other key manually via [Settings Settings]. ||
  * Note, *W/Q/~* are configurable in the [Settings#Tabs Tabs page of the Settings dialog].
  * Note, *Win* is default «Host key»
